description.title: steering assembly : precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: steering assembly : precautions for the repair

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: For an operation requiring the use of a lift, follow the safety advice vehicle : towing and liftingGIEMR-002447.

description.title: Instruction to be followed during the operation

noteR.para: Wear cut-resistant gloves during the operation.
Prepare for the flow of fluid, and protect the surrounding components.

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: Use a cover to protect any chassis elements that may be contaminated with power-assisted steering fluid.

description.title: Instruction to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: Clean the area around the power-assisted steering using BRAKE CLEANER vehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.
To ensure correct operation and performance of the system, do not attempt to repair any components other than those supplied in After-Sales.
To ensure the quality of the repair, only use the tooling recommended by the manufacturer.
Use only fluid recommended by the manufacturer to ensure correct operation of the system vehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.
To prevent impurities from entering the power assisted steering circuit, use blanking plugs on the various dismantled parts.
To ensure a sound power-assisted steering circuit seal, replace the power-assisted steering pipe seals each time a pipe is removed.

noteR.para: In order not to damage the steering wheel or steering column, the steering wheel-column foolproofing devices must be aligned.

descbody.para: Do not rest the steering column on the adjustment handle.
Do not handle the steering column by the adjustment handle or by the wiring.

Handle the "steering column - intermediate shaft" assembly by holding each section (one hand on the column and the other on the intermediate shaft). If the steering column is not handled correctly, there is a risk that the steering column or intermediate shaft could fall, which could destroy the system.
Always replace the steering column if it is dropped or in the event of an impact.
The steering box should not be carried by the gaiters or pipes, as this may damage them.
When the vehicle is positioned with the wheels suspended, the steering rack must not be subjected to violent movements from lock to lock.
Risks: Damage to the teeth of the steering rack and pinion may cause a SAFETY RISK whereby the steering locks unexpectedly.

descsection.para: The axial ball joint limiters 1 are colour coded for foolproofing purposes. When removing or replacing the axial ball joint, check that the limiter with the correct colour code is refitted.

descbody.para: Do not run the engine without steering fluid in the circuit.
Do not run the engine without steering fluid in the circuit.
Ensure that the electrical wiring is clean and correctly routed.
